message.entry: Complex input arguments are not supported.
First argument must be a numeric or logical array, a table, or a timetable.
Table variables must be column vectors.
Dimension is not supported when the first argument is a table or timetable.
Dimension must be a positive integer.
Incorrect number of input arguments. Parameter names and values must occur in pairs.
Parameter name must be ''MaxNumExtrema'', ''MinSeparation'', ''MinProminence'', ''FlatSelection'', or ''SamplePoints''.
Parameter name must be ''MaxNumExtrema'', ''MinSeparation'', ''MinProminence'', ''FlatSelection'', ''SamplePoints'', ''DataVariables'', or ''OutputFormat''.
''MaxNumExtrema'' value must be a positive integer.
''MinProminence'' value must be a nonnegative numeric scalar.
''MinSeparation'' value must be a nonnegative, real, finite scalar.
''ProminenceWindow'' value must be a positive scalar or 2-element vector of nonnegative scalars.
''ProminenceWindow'' value must be a duration if the ''SamplePoints'' values are datetimes or durations.
''ProminenceWindow'' value must be numeric if the ''SamplePoints'' values are numeric.
''ProminenceWindow'' value must be a duration when the first input argument is a timetable.
''MinSeparation'' value must be a duration scalar if the ''SamplePoints'' values are datetimes or durations.
''MinSeparation'' value must be a numeric scalar if the ''SamplePoints'' values are numeric.
''MinSeparation'' value must be a duration scalar when the first input argument is a timetable.
''FlatSelection'' must be ''first'', ''center'', ''last'', or ''all''.
''FlatSelection'' must be ''first'', ''center'', or ''all''.
Invalid data type. ''SamplePoints'' value must be a double, single, datetime, or duration vector.
The number of elements in the ''SamplePoints'' value must equal the size of the first argument along the operating dimension.
''SamplePoints'' value contains non-finite elements.
''SamplePoints'' value must be real.
Sparse ''SamplePoints'' values are not supported.
''SamplePoints'' value contains duplicates.
''SamplePoints'' value must be sorted in ascending order.
Row times must be finite.
Row times contain duplicates.
Row times must be sorted in ascending order.
''SamplePoints'' parameter is not supported when the first input argument is a timetable.
''DataVariables'' parameter is only supported when the first input argument is a table or timetable.
Table variables must be numeric.
''DataVariables'' function handle must return a logical scalar.
Invalid ''DataVariables'' value.
''OutputFormat'' parameter is only supported when the first input argument is a table or timetable.
''MinSeparation'' value must be a nonnegative, real, finite scalar or a two-element cell array of valid scalars.
First argument must be a numeric or logical array.
''MinSeparation'' value must be a 2-element cell array if the sample points along the rows and columns of the input data have incompatible types.
''ProminenceWindow'' is not supported for code generation.
'DataVariables' parameter cannot contain duplicates for code generation.
